    • listener

      private void listener()
      Listener method to check if any of the drop-down or text fields changes. If so then do the following actions such as population another drop-down, etc...

    • setStage

      public void setStage​(javafx.stage.Stage stage)
      Set the stage of the scene
      Parameters:
      stage - the stage we want to use

    • getDept

      private void getDept()
      Iterate through the list of "class" table from the database and insert the department code into the department drop-down

    • getClassNumber

      private void getClassNumber()
      Iterate through the list of "class" table from the database and insert the class number from the user selected department to the class number drop-down

    • getCourse

      private java.lang.String getCourse()
      This method references the selected class number and return the string of the class name of that selected class number
      Returns:
      class name

    • confirmButton

      private boolean confirmButton()
      confirm button to delete the selected course. It checks if the drop-downs are empty, if not then it checks for the JSON object of the selected drop-downs of department and class number to delete that JSON object from the database
      Returns:
      true if the course is deleted and false otherwise

    • back

      private void back​(javafx.scene.control.Button button, java.lang.String title, java.lang.String message, java.lang.Boolean goBackToPrevPage)
      This method is the back confirmation action. Its parameters are taken into account for two different scenarios. Scenarios include going back to the home page or canceling the deletion request which just stays on the same page.
      Parameters:
      button - the button to initialize
      title - the title of the alert
      message - the message of the alert
      goBackToPrevPage - boolean variable to identify the two scenario
